short_summary: Upgrade fire panels at Bath Institution
description: This is a summary of the statement of work for this requirement.
full_summary:
=====================================

**Fire Panel Upgrades at Bath Institution**
----------------------------------------

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites qualified contractors to bid on the Fire Panel Upgrades project at Bath Institution in Kingston, Ontario. This contract aims to upgrade the existing Siemens MXL Fire Alarm Panels to Desigo Modular System to ensure compliance with the institution's fire alarm and detection systems.

**Project Overview**
-------------------

The project involves replacing existing MXL Fire Alarm Panels with Desigo Modular System in 15 locations at Bath Institution. This upgrade will enable the institution to maintain a high level of fire safety and prevention.

**Statement of Work**
------------------

The successful bidder shall provide all necessary labor and materials to complete the upgrade. The scope of the project includes:

* Supply and installation of Desigo Modular System in the following locations:
	+ BB02: Kitchen/CorCan Building
	+ BB03: Accommodation Unit 1/Works Building
	+ BB04: Bath Powerhouse
	+ BB05: Recreation Building
	+ BB06: Informatics/Unit 2 Building
	+ BB07: Programs Building
	+ BB12: Lower Unit 3 Building
	+ BB18: Visits & Correspondence Building
	+ BB19: Admission & Discharge Building
	+ BB20: Chapel Building
	+ BB24: Upper Unit 3 Building
	+ BB26: Education Center Building
	+ BB32: Stores Building
* Complete programming of all new fire panel systems
* Configure new displays to operate as intended
* Verify all new equipment against CAN/ULC standards
* Upgrade includes re-programming of existing custom configuration software to maintain existing Sequence of Operation programming and ULC listing
* Handover of compatible materials to the CSC representative for spares or other uses

**Important Notes**
-----------------

* Site visit is mandatory on January 30th, 2024, at Bath Institution
* Bidders must communicate with the Contracting Authority by January 26th, 2024, to confirm attendance
* Bidders who do not attend the site visit or fail to sign the attendance sheet will be considered non-responsive
* Any clarifications or changes to the bid solicitation resulting from the site visit will be included as an amendment
